bibl.title: Despatch from William D. McCoy to William F. Wharton, June 21, 1892
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: Consulate of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, June 21, 1892.
William D. McCoy, to the Assistant Secretary of State.
Submission of a copy of President Cheeseman's Address to the Liberian Merchants.
Consulate of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, June 21, 1892.
Honorable WIlliam F. Wharton, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington, D. C.
Sir: I have the honor to submit to you a copy of an address delivered by President Cheeseman to the Merchants of this city.
William D. McCoy Minister Resident and Consul General.
ure y of President Cheeseman's Address.
ADDRESS OF PRESIDENT CHEESEMAN, TO THE LIBERIAN AND FOREIGN MERCHANTS, AT THE MANION HOUSE, MAY 30. 1892 MONROVIA: T W. HOWARD, PRINTER.
